Most Illustrious Sir

Since D. Antônio Casas, according to the Government's order, delivered to the collector Vasco Amaro the amount of five thousand nine hundred and forty-five pesos, thus exceeding by 945 pesos the five thousand that Your Lordship Casas handed over on the second of last November, it is necessary that Your Lordship receive the nine hundred and forty-five pesos, having the proper receipt for its discharge and to have it accounted for in the Treasury.

God keep Your Lordship  
Piratini, December 15, 1838.  
Bento Gonçalves da Silva

Most Illustrious Sir Joaquim Pereira Fagundes,  
Police Commander of Begé.

Bagé, January 30, 1839.

I received from Mr. Antônio Casas. It is in order.  
Joaquim Pereira Fagundes

It is in order.  
The senior officer and secretary.  
Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro
